name: 3-Methyl-1H-indole

The introduction of a methyl group to the indole typically raises the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and slightly increased van der Waals forces. The influence of a methyl group on an aromatic system can generally be estimated at around +20 to +30 degrees Celsius for the melting point. However, indole's nitrogen and its interaction with the methyl group contribute to an additional increase. Therefore, a conservative estimate could be an increment of around 40-45 degrees Celsius over the indole base.
